Description:
A gold, kneeling nude woman, with her body turned at the waist and her arms raised behind her head, is placed against a curvilinear, symmetrical gold framework set with small diamonds. 

Characteristic of Lalique's most flamboyant Art Nouveau style is the nude's enameled, cascading red hair. The use of an entire human figure as a decorative motif was considered a remarkable innovation in jewelry design.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Objects of Adornment: Five Thousand Years of Jewelry from the Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore

Title: Brooch with Nude
